decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Omnath's ramp abilities to quickly generate mana and play powerful threats, while controlling the board with removal spells and enchantments. Yorion is used as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Mazemind Tome and Escape to the Wilds help maintain card advantage. The deck also includes a selection of powerful planeswalkers and creatures like Nissa and Zacama to close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure all colors are available for the deck's powerful spells.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on combining low-cost creatures with disruptive spells to overwhelm opponents quickly. The key strategy is to efficiently build a board presence while using cards like Collected Company and Elite Spellbinder to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes resilient threats like Skyclave Apparition and Trostani, Three Whispers to help maintain board control. By utilizing a mix of creatures, disruption, and land ramp, this deck aims to create a fast and powerful offense that can quickly close out games.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing a large amount of card draw and counterspells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells and board wipes to deal with threats on the board. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant position with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and finish the game with large flying threats like Shark Typhoon.

The deck focuses on using Indomitable Creativity to cheat out powerful creatures or tokens by sacrificing weaker tokens or creatures. It also utilizes Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to create a loop of sacrificing and bringing back creatures. The deck includes a mix of spells and lands that help to control the board and protect the combo pieces. The main win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures or tokens generated through the combo. The synergy between the cards allows for explosive plays and unexpected victories.

This deck revolves around the combo of Lotus Field with cards like Hidden Strings and Omniscience to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful spells such as Emergent Ultimatum. The deck aims to search for and assemble its key pieces quickly using cards like Sylvan Scrying and Pore Over the Pages, while also utilizing untap effects from Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Thespian's Stage to generate even more mana. The deck also includes various lands like Bala Ged Recovery and Lair of the Hydra for additional utility and flexibility in gameplay.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays using powerful Rakdos creatures and spells to quickly chip away at your opponent's life total. Utilizing cards like Archfiend of the Dross and Bonecrusher Giant for direct damage, while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and Graveyard Trespasser. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, while also generating value and resilient threats with cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The goal is to pressure your opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing cards like Narset, Parter of Veils, Dovin's Veto, and Supreme Verdict to prevent the opponent from developing their board. Memory Deluge and other card draw spells provide the player with a steady stream of resources, while Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides an additional advantage. The deck also includes lands like Field of Ruin and utility lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire to further control the battlefield.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay utilizing Spirit creatures to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of disruptive and tempo cards, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. Cards like Mausoleum Wanderer, Spell Queller, and Supreme Phantom help to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Collected Company allows for explosive plays and the ability to flood the board with more threats. Overall, the deck's strategy is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure to force the opponent into a defensive position.

The deck focuses on using Transmogrify to turn cheap tokens into powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Reckoner Bankbuster. It also includes ways to protect your combo pieces with cards like Negate and Spell Pierce. The deck also has efficient removal spells like Flip the Switch and Volcanic Spite to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Shark Typhoon and Fiery Impulse provide additional value and versatility in different situations. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This Pioneer deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and utilizing cards that generate value quickly. With a mix of low-cost creatures, artifact removal spells, and support cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Warden of the Inner Sky, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient board presence. By leveraging Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, the deck gains additional flexibility and consistency in its game plan. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruption, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a low-to-the-ground creature strategy. The key concept behind this deck is to deploy efficient threats early on, backed up by disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes powerful aggressive cards like Venerated Loxodon and Warden of the Inner Sky to quickly close out games. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in the deck's overall strategy.
